intro: Eritrichium glomeratum var. hispidissimum, commonly known as the hispid glomerate fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. The hairy texture of its leaves and stems is a key identifying feature of this variety.
